definition: to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen

sentences.english: But some experts cautioned that the science in the study is still very early.
sentences.chinese: 但有些专家申饬说，研究的学科仍在初期。

sentences.english: I would - tell U not 2 cry.
sentences.chinese: 我想要申饬你不要流泪。

sentences.english: One thorn of experience is worth a full wilderness of warning.
sentences.chinese: 一次难过的经历抵得上千百次的申饬。

sentences.english: It was early on a Sunday morning and the Americans had no warning.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个星期天的清晨，美国根柢没有取得申饬。

definition: to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
